goal_name: An enabling business environment, creating opportunities and employment for entrepreneurs throughout Vanuatu
target_name: Increase production and processing of niche commodities, and value addition to commodities in which Vanuatu enjoys a comparative advantage
indicator_name: ECO4.3.2 Ratio of processed export commodities (including coconut, kava, cocoa, coffee) to raw exports
GoalDescription: An enabling business environment, creating opportunities and employment for entrepreneurs throughout Vanuatu
PolicyObjectiveDescription: Increase production and processing of niche commodities, and value addition to commodities in which Vanuatu enjoys a comparative advantage
IndicatorDescription: ECO4.3.2 Ratio of processed export commodities (including coconut, kava, cocoa, coffee) to raw exports
ComputationMethod:
* Get the total number of processed export commodities to raw exports
* To calculate the ratio of an amount we divide the amount by the total number of parts in the ratio and then multiply this answer by the original ratio.
Concept:
* The term commodities are generally understood as goods that are essentially the same no matter where they are produced. 
* Raw material extracted from the environment directly without further process but is export directly to other country.
DataSource:
* Department of Trade
* Department of Agriculture & Rural Development (DARD)
* Department of Customs & Inland Revenue (CIR)
Definition:
·      Export commodities are substances or good that are produced in a country, then shipped to others for distribution and sale abroad. (processed export commodities include agricultural products that have been extracted and modify using certain chemical to alter the product to preserved the produce but at the same time add more value to the product)
·      A raw material is an unprocessed material, or primary commodity, it is a basic material that is used to produce goods or finished products.
IndicatorShortName: Ratio of Processed Export Commodities to Raw Export, Value
Rationale:
* To understand which two process of export has the most impact on the economy of Vanuatu 
* What major goods are being exported
